question: He wants you to turn, look in camera and say the lines.
Yes, turn to camera.
Right side. And with intensity.
answer: Is that everything? It seemed like he was saying a lot more.

question: Like an old friend, and into the camera.
answer: For relaxing times, make it Suntory Time.

question: Could you do it slower, and with more intensity?
answer: Okay. For relaxing times, make it Suntory Time.

question: Mr. Harris?
Mr. Kazuzo sent me.
Can I enter? Mr. Harris?
Do you like massage?
Mr. Kazuzo send Premium Fantasy. My stockings.
Take them. No - Lip them... Don't touch me! Lip my stockings! Lip them!
answer: Huh? Oh, you want me to rip them?

question: Please let me go! Let me go!
answer: I think you should leave. I'll have to see about that. Can you get me on a flight Thursday night?

question: I think you should leave. I'll have to see about that. Can you get me on a flight Thursday night?
answer: We're looking into it Bob, but they really want you to stay to do that talk show Friday, apparently it's a really big deal, he's the Johnny Carson of Japan.

question: Yeah, they told me.
answer: These people are paying you a lot, do you think you could consider it?

question: Just get me out of here as soon as you can.
answer: Ok, you're scheduled to leave Saturday, but we'll hold a seat Thursday in case, but first class is full, you're waitlisted for an upgrade... there might be a seat on Lufthansa...

question: I'm not sure.
What are you doing here?
answer: My wife needs space, I don't know my kids ' birthdays. Everyone wants Tiger Woods, but they could get me, so I'm here doing a whiskey commercial.

question: Oh. I'll just have a beer.
answer: What about you? Why are you here?

question: My husband's here for work-he's a photographer- and I just came along...I'm not really doing anything right now, and we have some friends who live here.
answer: How long have you been married?

question: Two years.
You're probably just having a mid- life crisis. Did you buy a Porche?
25 years... that's a long time... Are you still in love with your wife?
answer: Yes... I don't know, I don't know her anymore. I don't know if you can be in love with one person the whole time. I was... actually I was in love with her sister first, when I was twenty-one. And one day her sister said to me she wanted to move to Paris, so I said okay, and she said no, she wanted to move to Paris with Francois, and she's still married to him. And I moved in with Lydia... but I always really liked Lydia.

question: Oh.
I'm not sure, yet... I graduated last spring.
Philosophy.
answer: Oh, what do you do with that?

question: I don't know, but I can think about it, a lot.
answer: It takes a while to figure it out. I'm sure you will, though.

question: Thanks. I'm sure your mid-life crisis will work out,too.
John! What are you doing here?
answer: I'm just here shooting this band, what about you?

question: Promoting that action movie I did... ...doing like twenty million interviews a day... It's soo good to see you. How long are you here for?
answer: We're here for the week. I'm shooting in Osaka for a few days.

question: It's amazing there!
answer: Have you met Charlotte? My wife.

question: You know, John, you're my favorite photographer, I only want to be shot by you.
Sorry if I have the worst B.O., I've been sweating in this little room with T.V. lights for hours...
...Well, I have the worst headache, I have to go find some aspirin. But, call me, let's have a drink, I'm under Evelyn Waugh.
Ok, see you later.
What?
Oh, c'mon, she's nice. Not everyone went to Yale. Its just a pseudonym, it doesn't matter.
answer: Why do you have to defend her?

question: I'm not, but do you have to point out how stupid everyone is.
answer: No, I thought it was funny. Forget it.

question: OK, I'll see you later.
How'd it go today?
answer: Good...I'm tired. I gotta go meet Kelly for a drink downstairs. She wants to talk about some photo thing.

question: Ok. Maybe I'll walk down with you.
Sure.
No, what are you talking about.
answer: I went to a temple today and I didn't feel anything.

question: That's ok.
answer: I don't know what to do.

question: That's ok, you'll figure it out.
What?
I got some hair stuff.
I gotta go to work. I'll be right down...I'm just leaving...ok. See you later.
answer: Bye. Lauren? It's cool... but,I don't know... I went to a shrine today and all these little monk's were chanting... and, I didn't feel anything... I even tried ikebana, ... and John's using hair products... I don't know who I. Sure. Oh, it's nothing... I better go, I'll talk to you later. Ok, bye. Ouch.

question: At the fitting, they had all these rock n roll clothes, the label guys kept saying lock n loll, though, but the band doesn't look tough at all...they look better just skinny and nerdy, like how when they came in...they looked so uncomfortable in these Keith Richards clothes, they should just be like they are, don't you think?
Yeah, I think you're probably right... because when you try to...
I don't know. Will you please stop smoking?
answer: But I like to... and I don't smoke that much.

question: Its bad for you.
A Soul's Search
answer: Oh... that's nothing, someone gave it to me.

question: You don't have to be embarrassed.
answer: I'm not. It's just corny, but I'm not into it.

question: It's ok if you are. Oh, the record company sent these...
answer: Mmm, I love Cristal, let's have some.

question: I gotta go... and I don't really like champagne. Are you sure you want to stay?
answer: Are you sure you have to go? Yeah, I know you have to work the whole time, I'll probably have more fun here. I'll call Charlie and those guys.

question: Ok, definitely call them, I'll be back Friday. I love you.
answer: I love you. I miss you.

question: It'll just be a few days.
Oh, hi.
answer: Hi. Did you have a nice swim?

question: Yeah. Did you get some sleep?
Not really. How long are you here for?
Oh, good. Do you want to go to a party tonight with me and some friends who live here?
You really are having a mid-life crisis.
answer: I know, it's stupid. A Soul's Search

question: No.
Charlie, this is Bob. Bob  Charlie Brown.

His real name's Hayashi, but someone started calling him Charlie because they thought he looked like Charlie Brown. They've all got American nicknames because its easier for me to remember... they were just out in L.A. last month doing a shoot with John... that guy's Mr.Valentine, he's the art director of their magazine, I don't even know his real name, or why I call him that. Hi. Good. Thanks, you guys should come back sometime. What do you feel like singing, Bob?
You bite your nails? I could cut the ones that are left for you.
Hans? Nice to meet you.
I don't want to go home.
answer: I know. I don't either. Lydia?

question: I know. I don't either. Lydia?
Lydia, I went to this great house tonight, this guy designed and built, you would have loved it.
answer: Oh, yeah? I wish I had seen it.

question: He was this fashion guy, and there were all these Japanese fashion people- it's a whole other world, and I was talking to these Japanese surfers... He was playing all this great music- I have to find out what it was...
answer: That sounds great  can you hold on... What Zoe? Well, you have to have something for breakfast. Do you want cereal? Just trying to get her to eat something...I'm glad you're having fun.

question: Yeah, its really different here.
answer: Well, that's good, I have to get the kids off for school. Can I call you in a little while?

question: It's four in the morning... I'm going to go to sleep.
I love you, too, good-night, or good- morning .
Hello?
Charlotte, who?
answer: Thanks for getting me back in one piece.

question: Of course.
answer: Do you want to have some breakfast?

question: Yeah, I'm going to take a shower and I'll meet you downstairs.
answer: OK, see you downstairs. Hey look, it's Sausalito.

question: Hans was very attentive to you.
answer: I think he kind of liked me...Is that so hard to imagine?

question: No, its easy.
answer: How'd a Japanese guy get a name like Hans?

question: I don't know.
answer: Do you remember when we met at the bar? ...You were wearing a tuxedo.

question: But the first time I saw you was in the elevator.
Yeah, you don't remember?
No, you smiled.
I know, I kind of blend in here.
answer: Why do they switch the r's and l's here?

question: I don't know. My fax said "have a good fright".
answer: Let's never come here again, because it would never be as much fun.

question: Ok, whatever you want.
answer: Did you see Hiromix last night dancing with Bambi?

question: No, I was looking at you.
answer: Oh. Well... they were dancing on the couch with that weird English guy who kept talking about hanging out with the Sex Pistols on Kings Road...

question: I got a fax today from your friend Hiromix.
No, for a candlelight dinner, yes, for her show.
You're possessive.
answer: I know. I'm stuck. Does it get easier.

question: No, yes, it does...
Thanks. It does, the more you know who you are... you don't care about things the same way...
answer: I just don't know what I'm supposed to be. I thought maybe I wanted to be a writer... but I hate what I write, and I tried taking pictures, but John's so good at that, and mine are so mediocre... and every girl goes through a photography phase, like horses, you know dumb pictures of your feet...

question: You'll figure it out. I'm not worried about you. Keep writing.
That's ok.
answer: And marriage, does that get easier?

question: It's hard. We started going to a marriage counselor.
answer: Did that help? Did you learn anything?

question: We established that we have no communication.

We used to have fun, she used to like to go to places with me for my movies and we would laugh at all the weirdos, but now she's tired of it all. She never wants to leave the kids, she doesn't need me, and they don't need me, I feel like I'm in the way. It gets complicated when you have kids... that changes everything.
When they're born its like Vietnam. It's terrifying.
answer: No one ever tells you that...

question: But, it's great being with them, after they can talk, and can do things with you.
answer: That's nice. My parents were always traveling, they weren't around so much.

question: Where'd you grow up?
answer: In D.C., my dad was the Ambassador to France in the eighties, so we went to school in Paris for a few years... but we mostly lived in D.C., and they were never around... and then I moved to Los Angeles when John and I got married... it's so different there.

question: I know.
You are.
answer: I know, but that's what you like about me. Why do you have to be with your opposite, why cant similar people be together?

question: Because that would be too easy. Hello?
answer: Mr. Harris, we have fax for you!

question: Ok.
answer: Do you want I send it to your room?

question: Great.
Miss Kawasaki? It's Bob Harris... I'm not going to be able to do that interview today.., yeah... ok.... Yes, I'd love to stay to be on his talk show... sure.. ok... bye.
They really have to work on that street name thing.
It's for my daughter.
Four.
Nice one.
What happened to your toe?
answer: I don't know, I think maybe I broke it? I knocked into something the other day...

question: That doesn't look good.
We should get you to the doctor.
Yeah, look at that thing. How do you say "hospital" in Japanese?
Hospital?
Yes, can you tell me how to say "hospital" in Japanese? Hosupitari? Hello?
Oh, hi, Elaine.
answer: So, we got you on an earlier flight, but I really think you should think about staying for that talk show.

question: Ok.
Hello?
Hi, Lydia.
Uh, no.
answer: It's really hard to reach you... Did you get the carpet samples? I like the burgundy.

question: Ok, whatever you think... I'm lost.
That's not what I'm talking about.
I don't know.
answer: Is there anything I can do?

question: I don't know... I want to be more healthy. I want to eat better.
You know, eat healthier.
Not all that pasta.
Like Japanese food.
answer: Why don't you just stay there, and you can have it everyday.

question: Oh, come on.
answer: I have to go, Adam's tormenting Zoe, I'll talk to you later. Are you going to be Ok?

question: Yeah, I'll be fine. Bye.
answer: Hi Bob, it's Charlotte... how are you doing today?... I'm going to meet Charlie and those guys at this place called Orange around ten... come meet us if you get this... How long have you been here? C'mon, let's go.

question: Where's your husband?
Do you ever see him?
Do you know where we are?
answer: No. Isn't it weird there are no street names in Tokyo... you'd think a city like this would have street names... you need a map to get anywhere... look, there are no signs... Um..Hi, John, if this is your phone? I'm not sure...I'm going to go to Kyoto for the day...I'11 try you when I get back. Hope it's going good... I love you, bye.

question: I don't want to be. Hello?
Hello?
I couldn't hear you. How are you?
It's ok.
What?
answer: Do you want to talk to Zoe?

question: Yeah.
answer: Zoe, come say hello to your father... I guess she's busy.

question: That's ok.
Tomorrow.
answer: Her ballet recital is Saturday, don't forget.

question: Ok.
answer: Ok, well, travel safely. See you soon.

question: Bye.
answer: You can't get sushi anywhere in Japan after 2 o'clock. Did you know that?

question: No, we'll find something around here.
answer: The Jazz singer? The red-head? Well, I guess she's more around your age... You guys could talk about things in common, like growing up in the fifties.

question: You're a brat, wasn't there anyone else around to lavish you with attention?
We'll have two of these. What do you want to drink?
So, where'd you go today.
answer: Around. They're not going to play the whole album, are they?

question: I'm sorry.
answer: That lunch was the worst, huh. When are you leaving?

question: Tomorrow.
That's what you said the other night.
answer: Well, I mean it more now.
